H0.text: Color is the property of sugar that remains after sugar is dissolved in water.

H1.text: Taste is the property of sugar that remains after it is dissolved in water.

H2.text: Shape is the property of sugar that remains after sugar is dissolved in water.

H3.text: Texture is the property of sugar that remains after sugar is dissolved in water.

A4.text: The strength and nature of solvent-solute interactions influence many properties of the solute, including color

A5.text: physical properties, which can be discerned without changing the substance's structure

A6.text: chemical properties cannot be determined just by viewing or touching the substance; the substance's internal structure must be affected greatly for its chemical properties to be investigated
